stems.BSC: (to be) food and drink; to eat and drink
stems.CTE: (to be) (the biological process of consuming) food and drink as nourishment; eat/drink as nourishment
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical process of food/drink consumption, the physical process of eating/drinking (i.e., placement of consumable in mouth/chewing/swallowing/digestion).
stems.OBJ: (to be) the food and drink one consumes; the actual food/drink items one consumes

stems: (to be) food, i.e., (semi-/quasi-)solid consumable/digestible material; to eat (semi-/quasi-)solid food
(to be) a drink, i.e., a consumable/digestible liquid; to drink

stems.BSC: (to be) an act of chewing/mastication on something; to chew something; to masticate on something
stems.CTE: (to be) the biological process of chewing/mastication; chewing as a biological process
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical process of chewing/mastication [use Phase categories if necessary to specify a single iteration or other pattern of chewing]
stems.OBJ: (to be) the entity/piece of food/object one chews on

stems: (to be) an act of swallowing something

(to be) an act of biting (on) something; to bite (on) something [i.e., sink the forward half of one's teeth into an entity in order to either bite off a piece, deliver venom, or to keep it from escaping] [CPT = to bite off (a piece of) something]

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of stirring something; to chew something; to masticate on something
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of something being stirred or undergoing stirring
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical process of stirring [use Phase categories if necessary to specify a single iteration or appropriate affixes or concatenation with shape/form roots to describe particular patterns of stirring]

stems: (to be) an act/instance of “folding” something into something else as in baking; to “fold” as in baking (i.e., combining a lighter/thinner component into a heavier/thicker component while retaining as much air as possible)
(to be) an act/instance of mechanically blending something via rotary action (as with a mechanical or electric- powered blender)
notes: (useful to describe food preparation but also applicable any other appropriate context)

stems: spread with finger(s) (CPT = coat by means of spreading)
spread with spreading utensil (CPT = coat by means of spreading)
dip into (CPT = coat by dipping into)
whip, i.e., soften or liquify via whipping with a utensil (as in cooking/baking)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of there being a particular food or beverage available for consumption
stems.CTE: (to be) an amount/portion of a particular food/beverage (the entity/substance or liquid itself)
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of eating/drinking a particular food or beverage; to eat/drink a particular food or beverage
stems.OBJ: (to be) a serving/dish/plate/glass/cup of a particular food or beverage; to serve (a dish/plate/glass/cup) of a particular food or beverage

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of making/preparing/cooking or fermenting a particular food or beverage
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of a food or beverage in preparation/being cooked/being fermented
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical act of making/preparing/cooking or fermenting a particular food or beverage
stems.OBJ: (to be) the prepared/cooked/fermented food or beverage itself to be served

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of sourcing or raising or farming/growing/cultivating the animal/plant/mineral that will become a foodstuff
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of an animal/plant/mineral being raised, grown, cultivated, or being a source for food
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of sourcing, raising, growing, cultivating an animal/plant/mineral for food
stems.OBJ: (to be) the plant/animal/mineral that will be (consumed as) food

refers: DISH/RECIPE MADE FROM/WITH ANIMAL PRODUCTS / NON-VEGAN DISH
DISH/RECIPE MADE FROM/WITH REPTILIAN OR AMPHIBIAN FLESH
DISH/RECIPE MADE FROM/WITH A MIXTURE OF ANIMAL/PLANT PRODUCTS/PARTS

notes: (i.e., an alcoholic beverage made by the fermentation of a fruit, whether grapes, apples, berries, etc. - thus this stem includes the meaning of the English terms (alcoholic) *cider and perry*)
(other than fruit-based wine or beer, e.g., mead, vegetable-based liquor, nut-based liqueurs, etc.)

refers: “SUGAR” [i.e., as foodstuff, not as chemical compound]
